content:
A user reported a bug in this contrib module. I'd like to try and fix it, but I could use a little help. I've updated the issue here:
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style/issues/8

Does anyone have time to look? I ask, because I have a hunch that this one won't be too hard to solve, but just hard enough that I can't do it myself.

Custom block gets "Call to undefined function template_preprocess_block" error · Issue #8 · backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style
If I set any (or both) of 2 custom blocks on the BD home layout to "Style: Configurable", and then save the layout, I get both a "successful save" message, but the whole page go...
It seems that @Laryn figured it out :smile:
Credit to @hosef not me. :wink:
That's what I meant :sweat_smile:

I created a PR that allows a user to add a tint over a background image in a hero block. I would love feedback.
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style/issues/11

Tint over hero images · Issue #11 · backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style
If it's a hero block, it would be nice to have the option to select a tint over the image through the block configuration. I'm not yet sure if this configuration should only be available on...

@Joseph Flatt - I added some screenshots to the wiki for the module and merged a PR that adds some instructions to the Readme file.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style/wiki

backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style
Ability to style blocks through UI. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style development by creating an account on GitHub.
...and I made the wiki page a bit better :wink:
Thanks @StPaulTim and @klonos :+1:
